member.name: T:RobinHood70.CommonCode.BitReader
member.summary: A quick hack of a class to make BitConverter act a bit more like BinaryReader.
member.remarks: There is currently almost no buffer overflow checking apart from that provided by the BitConverter calls, so those methods will simply crash if you do overflow.

member.name: T:RobinHood70.CommonCode.CsvFile
member.summary: Reads or writes a CSV file, including tab-separated files and similar formats.
member.remarks: This class is primarily designed to handle entire files at once. - and -based methods are also available to support streaming and the like.

member.name: P:RobinHood70.CommonCode.CsvFile.AlwaysDelimitFields
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether fields should always be delimited as text.
member.value: if fields should always be delimited; otherwise, (in which case, delimiting is automatic as needed).

member.name: P:RobinHood70.CommonCode.CsvFile.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of rows currently in the file.

member.name: P:RobinHood70.CommonCode.CsvFile.DoubleUpDelimiters
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to double up the character if emitted as part of the field value or use the .
member.value: if a delimiter character should be emitted twice; if it should be escaped instead.

member.name: P:RobinHood70.CommonCode.CsvFile.EmptyFieldText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to emit if a field is present but is an empty string.
member.value: The text to use for empty fields.
member.remarks: If this field is null, empty fields will be treated the same as null fields. If it's an empty string, two field delimiters will be emitted with nothing between them. For any other value, that value will be emitted, with field delimiters emitted (or not) as normal.

member.name: P:RobinHood70.CommonCode.CsvFile.EscapeCharacter
member.summary: Gets or sets the escape character.

member.name: P:RobinHood70.CommonCode.CsvFile.FieldDelimiter
member.summary: Gets or sets the field delimiter.
member.value: The field delimiter. Defaults to a double-quote (").

member.name: P:RobinHood70.CommonCode.CsvFile.FieldSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets the field separator.
member.value: The field separator. Defaults to a comma (,).

member.name: P:RobinHood70.CommonCode.CsvFile.Header
member.summary: Gets or sets the header row.
member.value: The header row. if there is no header row (HasHeader = false or there are no rows in the file).

member.name: P:RobinHood70.CommonCode.CsvFile.IgnoreSurroundingWhiteSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to ignore surrounding white space.
member.value: if leading or trailing whitespace in a field should be ignored when no delimiter is present; otherwise, .
member.remarks: When this is set to , a row of ABC, DEF is treated the same as ABC,DEF; when false, the second value would be " DEF" rather than "DEF".

member.name: P:RobinHood70.CommonCode.CsvFile.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets or sets the at the specified index.
member.returns: The row at the specified index.

member.name: T:RobinHood70.CommonCode.Filter
member.summary: Represents a tristate filter, where the options are to show everything, show only the selected items, or hide the selected items.
member.remarks: This is an alias for Tristate, but is much clearer in its intent than having True/False/Unknown values.

member.name: F:RobinHood70.CommonCode.Filter.Any
member.summary: Include all results; do not filter.

member.name: F:RobinHood70.CommonCode.Filter.Only
member.summary: Include only these results. Note that in cases where.

member.name: F:RobinHood70.CommonCode.Filter.Exclude
member.summary: Exclude these results.

member.name: T:RobinHood70.CommonCode.Tristate
member.summary: Represents a binary value which also allows for an unknown state.
member.remarks: This is used in preference to a due to the fact that it is both smaller and makes the code much clearer.

member.name: F:RobinHood70.CommonCode.Tristate.Unknown
member.summary: An unknown or unassigned value.

member.name: F:RobinHood70.CommonCode.Tristate.True
member.summary: The value is True.

member.name: F:RobinHood70.CommonCode.Tristate.False
member.summary: The value is false.

member.name: M:RobinHood70.CommonCode.Extensions.BString8(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Reads a length-prefixed string. Both length and characters should be bytes.
member.returns: The string.

member.name: M:RobinHood70.CommonCode.Extensions.ZString(System.IO.BinaryReader)
member.summary: Reads a null-terminated string. Characters should be bytes.
member.returns: The string.
member.remarks: For fixed-length strings, it's normally better to read the entire thing and then trim everything after the null. This function is intended for those cases where the length is unknown.

member.summary: Gets the value of the "first" item in a dictionary.

The value type of the dictionary.
member.param: The dictionary from which to retrieve the first value.
member.returns: The first value in the enumerable, or throws an error.
member.remarks: Although the current implementation of dictionaries appears to maintain insertion order, this is not guaranteed. This function should be used only to get the value from a single-entry dictionary, or to get a unspecified value from a multi-entry dictionary.

member.name: M:RobinHood70.CommonCode.Globals.CurrentCulture(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Convenience method so that CurrentCulture and Invariant are all in the same class for both traditional and formattable strings, and are used the same way.
member.param: The value of the parameter in the parameter.
member.returns: The formatted text.

member.name: M:RobinHood70.CommonCode.Globals.CurrentCulture(System.String,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Convenience method so that CurrentCulture and Invariant are all in the same class for both traditional and formattable strings, and are used the same way.
member.param: The value of the first parameter in the parameter.
The value of the second parameter in the parameter.
member.returns: The formatted text.

member.name: M:RobinHood70.CommonCode.Globals.CurrentCulture(System.String,System.Object,System.Object[])
member.summary: Convenience method so that CurrentCulture and Invariant are all in the same class for both traditional and formattable strings, and are used the same way.
member.param: The first value of any parameters in the .
The values of any parameters in the parameter.
member.returns: The formatted text.
member.remarks: The method signature is done this way because calling CurrentCulture with no parameters is nearly unintended, since no parameters require formatting. In the rare event where you're formatting a constant value according via CurrentCulture (e.g., { 1.0:2 }), use the long-form string.Format(CultureInfo.CurrentCulture, text) to achieve the same effect.

member.name: M:RobinHood70.CommonCode.Globals.EscapeDataString(System.String)
member.summary: Works around Uri.EscapeDataString's length limits.
member.returns: The escaped string.

member.name: M:RobinHood70.CommonCode.Globals.GetCulture(System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to figure out the culture associated with the language code, falling back progressively through parent languages.
member.returns: The nearest CultureInfo possible to the given or CurrentCulture if nothing is found.

member.summary: Gets the requested type of hash for the byte data provided.
member.returns: The hash, represented as a .

member.name: T:RobinHood70.CommonCode.TextArrays
member.summary: A static class of split values used throughout all related projects. This avoids frequent re-allocations of small array valuesparticularly important inside loops and frequently-called methods.

member.name: T:RobinHood70.CommonCode.ValidatedNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates to Code Analysis that a method validates a particular parameter.

member.name: T:RobinHood70.CommonCode.Validator
member.summary: This class contains some convenient one-off validation tests, as well as instantiators for the multi-test Validator{T} class.
member.remarks: While these tests can be used in sequence with one another, this will require repeating nameof() and possibly other values with each call. Validator{T} works around these issues, though may be slightly slower due to an increased need to cast the input being tested.

member.name: M:RobinHood70.CommonCode.Validator`1.NotNull
member.summary: Gets a Validator if the provided value is not null.
member.exception: Thrown if the value is null.
